Items.Title: Invocation
Items.MinutesNote: No Invocation was delivered at this Stated Meeting.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Withdrawing M-1161 - proposed maritime lease between the New York City Department of Small Business Services  and Hornblower New York, LLS.,   for certain areas and other improvements at Pier 15, located at Block 73, portion of Lot 2, Community District 1, Borough of Manhattan, pursuant to Section 1301(2)(f) of the City Charter.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Withdrawing M 1161 - Landmarks, City-owned berth areas and other improvements located on Pier 15, Manhattan (20135759 PNM)

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Report of the Committee on Land Use
Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 130116 ZMK, a Zoning Map amendment (L.U. No. 829).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 829 - Zoning, Lafayette Ave, Ashland Place, Hanson Place & Flatbush Ave, Brooklyn (C130116ZMK)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on Application No. N 130117 ZRK, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, relating to Article X Chapter 1 (Special Downtown Brooklyn District), to allow special permits for use and bulk modifications for cultural uses in certain C6-2 districts (L.U. No. 830).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 830 - Zoning. Special permits for use and bulk modifications for cultural uses in certain C6-2 districts, Brooklyn (N130117ZRK)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 130118 ZSK (L.U. No. 831), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 101-81 of the Zoning Resolution to permit the maximum floor area requirements of Section 33-123 (Community facility buildings or buildings used for both community facility and commercial uses in all other Commercial Districts) to be increased; and to modify Sections 101-41 (Special Street Wall Location Regulations), 23-632 (Front setbacks in districts where front yards are not required), and 32-64 (Surface Area and Illumination Provisions), Section 32-65 (Permitted Projection or Height of Signs) and Section 32-68 (Permitted Signs on Residential or Mixed Buildings) in connection with a proposed 32-story mixed use development, on property located at 113 Flatbush Avenue (Block 2110, Lots 3 and 103), in a C6-2 District, within the Special Downtown Brooklyn District, Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 831 - Zoning, Grant of a Special Permit, Brooklyn (C130118ZSK)

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Commissioner of Deeds be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an annual report on non-governmental funding for New York City parks.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Krueger and Squadron, S.3461-B, and Assembly Members Kavanagh and Stevenson, A.224-B, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in relation to the use of bicycles for commercial purposes”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Use of bicycles for commercial purposes. (S.3461-B/A.224-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Krueger and Squadron, S.3461-B, and Assembly Members Kavanagh and Stevenson, A.224-B, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in relation to the use of bicycles for commercial purposes”.
Items.MatterName: Use of bicycles for commercial purposes. (S.3461-B/A.224-B)

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)
The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera).

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, June 26, 2013.



ALISA FUENTES, Deputy City Clerk
Acting 
Clerk of the Council
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: Ms. Alisa Fuentes, Deputy City Clerk and Acting Clerk of the Council served as the Acting City Clerk during these proceedings.
